content: hey DM crafters welcome to the dam's craft
I'm DM Scotty good to have you with me today we're going to continue on with
our fire videos seems like I've been doing a lot of those lately this one
deals with brazzers I've done torches I just recently did a camp site with a
fire and this time I'm going to do a large brassiere for interior dungeon or
that kind of thing or a castle a fortress these are pretty easy to do
super cheap and a nice little set piece or light source for your game so let's
go to the table and start crafting those now
so the basis of our craft today is it's going to be this wood piece you can find
all kinds of interesting wood wooden shapes at craft stores and I just like
this shape for the project I'm doing and then I'm going to use cotton ball so
this is going to be very similar to the torch of it that I did so I'm just going
to get a little Bowl and I've got my water down glue down and I'm going to
coat this saturate that with the water down glue and that's the cotton ball and
I'm going to break it up hold the part like that gonna put a little more glue
on it and you kind of get a kind of get a nice fire texture that way by just
pulling it apart and you can kind of play with it
and then what I'll do is I'll just take my piece and just put it in there so now
I've got a nice little fire kind of ornament and I'll put that aside and I
was going to do two of them I'll do the other one and then we'll paint them up
and see what they look like here's my container and I'd taken the
fire out of it and it's it's fairly dry but it's a little not totally solid so
what I want to do is I'm going to put some more glue on it to help solidify
this and I'm going to use a toothpick to help me get it on without kind of
destroying the the delicate nature of the flames so kind of help the more glue
you put on it the stiffer it's going to end up so and
the more party it's going to be alright that looks good so I'll let that dry up
we'll have a nice solid flame there and then I'll up paint it up
although this is a neat shape I thought it was kind of dull so I thought I might
add some extra pizazz to it so I did is I got grabbed some cardstock and this is
a quarter of an inch and what I did was I put it on the side of this and then
bent it up and then marked where it hit the top of this here and then I cut a
piece off I cut that piece off and then I marked the rest of these the same
length and I also mark in the middle of this because what I want to do is put a
little arrow at the top so with this little piece here I cut like that like
that and that kind of helped me get the center so when I put this on it'll kind
of be like that so now I'm going to do the rest of these and then we'll come
back and we'll apply them to this little of urn type thing
now this will be a bit tricky because I don't want to use the white glue because
it curves and will be really hard to hold that down while it glues so
probably the best way to do it is use the hot glue so I have to be very
careful because there are very small pieces I don't wanna burn myself so get
a nice little bead on there around get it on there
hold that for a sec then BAM got that out of there
alright now I think the easiest way to do this is going to be if I do the exact
opposite side so I'm going to I'm going to go ahead and put the glue on the
object itself and see how that works and being able to be a little easier
yeah I think that worked out a little better
easier to handle alright so there we got some we got some nice detailed pop down
already now I'm going to do one over here one over here looks pretty nice so
now what I'm going to do is I'll go ahead and I'm going to do the two pieces
separately the flame versus the container I'm going to paint this black
and now I'll paint the container or I mean I'm sorry I'll paint this black and
then I'll paint the flame with just the flame color that you've seen me do
before so start with the yellow move on to the to the orange and then top it off
with some red alright so we'll hit that so here we are with the firearms next to
the some player characters and look how great they came out these were so easy
to make I'm going to pick one up and give you a little closer detail and then
talk about it so if you remember we use the wooden piece that we got from the
craft store and then these I just painted these bands like metal the body
of the urn was painted with a sponge doing the stone technique with the
sponge I add a little bit of highlight if there's curvature here and on the
bottom now one thing I did that gives a cool look to this is I added a little
bit of highlight around the edge in yellow so that makes it look like it's
glowing where the fires coming out it gives it a nice glow and then this is
just the fire here is just our fan our standard fire technique and that was
just the cotton ball that we ripped in half and soaked in glue and pulled up to
give it the fire look so just super super easy to do these I also add in a
washer on the bottom I just hot glued it to the bottom to give it a little bit of
weight so I won't slide around the table so there we go there are fire urns we're
going to look great on the table and see you next time for short tip hey guys if
you're really digging these videos and would like some more information or to
talk to other crafters look at the link below in the description and you can
join my forum on the DM z-- craft we'd love to have you and I'll see you there
you
